name: k-nearest-neighbor
description: In pattern recognition, the k-Nearest Neighbors algorithm (or k-NN for short) is a non-parametric method used for classification and regression. In both cases, the input consists of the k closest training examples in the feature space. The output depends on whether k-NN is used for classification or regression.
author: Rodrigo Oler <roodrigoprogrammer@gmail.com>
